author: raulj
content: <@295038156506660865> it depends on what exactly you want to measure. In many cases, spinning up an integration test in a language of your client, such as Go for go-ethereum and Prysm, and writing a unit could be easier than wrangling different scenarios with docker

author: raulj
content: in Prysm, we actually have an end-to-end testing suite which lets you do a lot, including running an execution client, and test things out in a controlled environment. You could implement your malicious node in there
